info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 2:31PM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Hazardous road conditions due to strong west winds, falling temperatures, a burst of snow, and blowing snow expected. * WHERE...La Salle, Kendall and Grundy Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions are expected to develop in open areas, particularly late tonight into Wednesday. Pockets of near white out conditions could develop along north south roads where unobstructed western exposure allows snow to blow across the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will gust as high as 45 to 50 mph Wednesday morning into the mid afternoon. Snow showers Wednesday morning could further exacerbate the hazardous road conditions and poor visibility issues. Wind chills will drop below zero by daybreak Wednesday. Consider postponing unnecessary travel in rural and outlying areas.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
